result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09:35 AM Attorney Melissa S. Inlow appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Manuel Garcia Salas appeared, pro se  Interpreter Enrique Soria was sworn and present to interpret.   Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Defendant would like to proceed without an attorney.   Waived reading of the complaint.   The Defendant Entered a plea of not guilty.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 03:20 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Manuel Garcia Salas
Current: PO Box 43, 236209 State Hwy 13, Dorchester, WI 54425   (Effective: 03-21-2022)
Prior: 236209 State Hwy 13, PO Box 43, Dorchester, WI 54425
Initial appearance on April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant is not to drive any motorized vehicle: (a) unless defendant is in possession of a valid Wisconsin operator's license for the type of motor vehicle being driven; (b) defendant and such motor vehicle are insured as required by law; and (c) defendant is in possession of valid proof of insurance while operating the motor vehicle.    Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.
